entry.title: Russia Takes Captured Mariupol Fighters to Its Territory
entry.content: More than 1,000 Ukrainian soldiers taken prisoner after the siege of Mariupol have been transferred to Russia, a Russian state-news agency reported, giving Moscow a powerful bargaining chip as its military campaign makes slow progress in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Fear and Destruction Turn Ukraine's Front-Line Cities Into Ghost Towns
entry.content: As Moscow’s forces push west, seeking to dislodge Ukrainians from their positions and seize control of the country’s east, residents are fleeing in droves, aided by volunteers who risk their lives to ferry them out.

entry.title: Fertilizer Price Surge Drives Brazil to High-Tech Alternatives
entry.content: Brazil has been testing ways to boost farm productivity and reduce the need for imported fertilizers for years, trying solutions that are now subjects of widespread interest because of the Ukraine war’s effect on global supplies.
